info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 8:28AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND... SOUTHERN MONTOUR AND CENTRAL COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 900 AM EDT... At 828 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Danville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Berwick, Danville, Elysburg, Riverside, Trevorton, Catawissa, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, Almedia, Fernville, Mechanicsville, Buckhorn, Numidia, Rupert, Slabtown, Rohrsburg, Mainville, Stonington and Shumans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
